channel.title: Peregrine Advisors Federal Data News
channel.description: Federal data news aggregated from a variety of news outlets.

item.title: Inside the Air Force Research Laboratory’s Contemporary Quantum Pursuits
item.description: The early quantum adopter is making strategic moves to develop on-the-rise capabilities—and manage the hype around them.

item.title: HHS Websites Will Get Customer Experience Scores in 2021
item.description: As part of the updated digital strategy, Health and Human Services Department program offices will be getting graded on a “CX scale.”

item.title: DOD Expands Data Repository for Business Information Across the Enterprise
item.description: The Defense Repository for Common Enterprise Data will be able to support more information systems across the agency with the new designation.

item.title: State Selects First Permanent Chief Data Officer
item.description: Matthew Graviss previously served as USCIS’ first CDO and will report to Janice deGarmo, who was recently promoted at State.

item.title: CMMC: The Dramatic Year of the Pentagon’s Contractor Cybersecurity Program
item.description: The Defense Department’s main effort to protect its supply chain from cyber threats charged ahead through the pandemic but not without controversy.

item.title: How Supercomputing and Advanced X-Rays Helped the Government Fight COVID-19
item.description: Years of basic research and speedy, strategic coordination helped to catalyze new and needed treatments.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence Begins to Realize Its Potential
item.description: Here's a look at some interesting projects, like one that helps programmers maintain and update COBOL.

item.title: DOD Released Its First Enterprisewide Data Strategy in 2020. Here’s Why It Matters.
item.description: While industry experts say the strategy lays a much-needed foundation, the devil’s in the details when it comes to implementation.

item.title: Critical Update: Why Having Artificial Intelligence Talent is a National Security Issue
item.description: Dr. José-Marie Griffiths discusses her work crafting workforce recommendations for Congress as part of her work with the National Security Commission on Artificial Intelligence.

item.title: IG: Last Major CBP System Outage Caused By Code Defect Known for 2 Years
item.description: The customs agency could have avoided an August 2019 system outage—and hours of delays for travelers—with better patch management and employee training on backup procedures.

item.title: In a Zero Trust World, Compliance Doesn’t Equal Security
item.description: An agency can run a completely compliant network and still be breached by a trusted user’s account being exposed.

item.title: The Tech Policies the Trump Administration Leaves Behind
item.description: Nextgov looks back at the Trump administration's major IT policy moves that will have lasting effects on federal technology for the foreseeable future.

item.title: Looking Beyond the Federal Data Strategy
item.description: We may be entering a Golden Age of data sharing.

item.title: A State Becomes the First to Suspend Facial Recognition Technology in Schools
item.description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said there are “serious and legitimate privacy concerns” with the technology—but only prohibited its use until 2022.

item.title: Defense, Intelligence Agencies Made Major Moves in Cloud in 2020
item.description: After bid protests and litigation, some of the largest cloud contracts the government has attempted can get underway.

item.title: Universal Service Fund Wants Automation Tools to Help Bring Broadband to Communities in Need
item.description: The corporation that manages the fund for the Federal Communications Commission is looking for a contractor to help automate its manual, time-consuming data verification process.

item.title: How the U.S. Can Fight the Opioid Epidemic During COVID-19
item.description: A majority of states—more than 40—have reported increases in opioid-related deaths since the beginning of the pandemic.

item.title: Thousands of Ocean Fishing Boats Could Be Using Forced Labor—We Used AI and Satellite Data to Find Them
item.description: Forced labor is a known problem in open ocean fishing, but the scale has been very hard to track historically.

item.title: CBP Should Halt Expansion of the Biometric Entry-Exit Program, Many Commenters Write
item.description: Advocacy groups and the City of Portland wrote the Homeland Security Department urging a full stop on expanding the use of facial recognition technologies.

item.title: Two Years into the Government’s National Quantum Initiative
item.description: An Office of Science and Technology Policy official offered a look back on what’s unfolded—and a glimpse into what’s to come.

item.title: Data Skills Catalog and Data Ethics Framework Now Available
item.description: Data Skills Catalog and Data Ethics Framework Now Available

item.title: Serving the Needs of Data Practitioners with a New resources.data.gov
item.description: We are excited to announce the relaunch of a new resources.data.gov , an online repository of policies, tools, case studies, and other resources to support data governance, management, exchange, and use throughout the federal government. The site is a joint effort … Continued

item.title: Updates to Data.gov Home Page
item.description: Data.gov has made a few updates to its home page in recent days. For users seeking information about the coronavirus, we have added a prominent link to coronavirus.gov We have also added navigation to two existing sites, strategy.data.gov and resources.data.gov . Strategy.data.gov is … Continued

item.title: Data.gov at Ten and the OPEN Government Data Act
item.description: This May marks the tenth anniversary of Data.gov, the federal government’s open data site. Launched by the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) in May 2009 with a modest 47 datasets, Data.gov has grown to over 200,000 datasets from hundreds of … Continued

item.title: Duplicate Entries Removed from Data.gov Catalog
item.description: In the last few days, you may have noticed a significant drop in the total number of datasets displayed on the Data.gov catalog . The decrease was not due to an actual reduction in the number of datasets, but the removal … Continued

item.title: Data.gov Catalog Update
item.description: The heart of Data.gov is the catalog . The Data.gov catalog brings together datasets from hundreds of agency sources across the federal government and from 50 non-federal sources. Metadata for datasets that are available to the public are maintained by the … Continued
